page.title: 03Crowhill
page.content: On a May day Crowhill is alive with {blossom}on the trees and banks; there are{primroses}and{wild strawberries}in the grass. Houses and a turning to a housing estate (St.Martin's Park) are on one side overlooking a grass verge,a fence and a hedge. Beyond these the land slopes down and on through{flat fields (so good for{grazing}beside the{River} {Cleddau)}to a mainly wooded area with a{footpath}down to the river bank. This footpath eventually leads to a {nature reserve}which is hidden from the road by some trees; it runs along side the river whose available water was once used to drive a{paper mill.} The many{streams}make it a suitable spot for the local{Angling Club. An{ancient stone bridge}crosses the river;after this the{roads narrow}and very few cars drive along them.
